bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 95 (Thursday, June 1, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NEGUSE:H.R. 3789.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to give theNational Taxpayer Advocate the authority to comment onTreasury regulations.[Page H2713]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text:
Comprehensive Legislation Ensuring Accountability and Responsiveness Act of 2023 or the CLEAR Act of 2023

This bill requires the Department of the Treasury to submit any proposed or temporary regulation, prior to its publication, to the National Taxpayer Advocate for comment on the impact of such regulation on taxpayer rights or taxpayer burden. Treasury must consider the comments of the National Taxpayer Advocate before prescribing any final regulation that supersedes a proposed or temporary regulation.

bill.title: CLEAR Act of 2023

item.title: Comprehensive Legislation Ensuring Accountability and Responsiveness Act of 2023
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to give the National Taxpayer Advocate the authority to comment on Treasury regulations.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
